Package br.com.armange.commons.thread

Class ScheduledCaughtExecutorService

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.util.concurrent.AbstractExecutorService
      • java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor
        • java.util.concurrent.ScheduledThreadPoolExecutor
          • br.com.armange.commons.thread.ScheduledCaughtExecutorService
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.util.concurrent.Executor, java.util.concurrent.ExecutorService, java.util.concurrent.ScheduledExecutorService
    @Deprecated(since="2.0.0",
            forRemoval=true)
public class ScheduledCaughtExecutorService
extends java.util.concurrent.ScheduledThreadPoolExecutor
    Deprecated, for removal: This API element is subject to removal in a future version.
    Consider to use ScheduledThreadBuilderExecutor A ScheduledThreadPoolExecutor that can additionally perform actions after thread has completed normally. Consider seeing java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor#afterExecute(Runnable, Throwable)
    Since:
    2019-11-26 V1.0.0 (JDK 1.8)
    See Also:
    ScheduledThreadPoolExecutor, afterExecute(Runnable, Throwable), addAfterExecuteConsumer(BiConsumer)

      • ScheduledCaughtExecutorService

        public ScheduledCaughtExecutorService​(int corePoolSize)
        Deprecated, for removal: This API element is subject to removal in a future version.
        Parameters:
        corePoolSize - the number of threads to keep in the pool, even if they are idle, unless allowCoreThreadTimeOut is set
        See Also:
        ScheduledThreadPoolExecutor(int)

      • ScheduledCaughtExecutorService

        public ScheduledCaughtExecutorService​(int corePoolSize,
                                      java.util.concurrent.ThreadFactory threadFactory)
        Deprecated, for removal: This API element is subject to removal in a future version.
        Parameters:
        corePoolSize - the number of threads to keep in the pool, even if they are idle, unless allowCoreThreadTimeOut is set
        threadFactory - the factory to use when the executor creates a new thread
        See Also:
        ScheduledThreadPoolExecutor(int, ThreadFactory)

    • Method Detail

      • afterExecute

        public void afterExecute​(java.lang.Runnable runnable,
                         java.lang.Throwable throwable)
        Deprecated, for removal: This API element is subject to removal in a future version.
        Method invoked upon completion of execution of the given Runnable. This method is invoked by the thread that executed the task. If non-null, the Throwable is the uncaught RuntimeException or Error that caused execution to terminate abruptly. This method will consume a list of java.util.function.BiConsumer with a runnable and a throwable as arguments. See addAfterExecuteConsumer(BiConsumer)
        Overrides:
        afterExecute in class java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor
        Parameters:
        runnable - the runnable that has completed
        throwable - the exception that caused termination, or null if execution completed normally

      • getAfterExecuteConsumers

        public java.util.List<java.util.function.BiConsumer<java.lang.Runnable,​java.lang.Throwable>> getAfterExecuteConsumers()
        Deprecated, for removal: This API element is subject to removal in a future version.
        Returns the consumers list that will be performed after thread completed normally.
        Returns:
        the consumers list that will be performed after thread completed normally.

      • addAfterExecuteConsumer

        public void addAfterExecuteConsumer​(java.util.function.BiConsumer<java.lang.Runnable,​java.lang.Throwable> afterExecuteBiConsumer)
        Deprecated, for removal: This API element is subject to removal in a future version.
        Adds the implementation that will be executed after the end (successfully) of the thread execution.
        Parameters:
        afterExecuteBiConsumer - the consumer that will be performed after thread has completed normally.
